title: UAJK, USEFP launch project to save endangered languages
dc:creator: Staff Writer
description:
MUZAFFARABAD, July 4: The Vice-Chancellor University of Azad Jammu and Kashmir Professor Dr. Muhammad Kaleem Abbasi has said that the centuries-old history, civilization, and culture of the region should be preserved and passed on to the next generations by preserving the Kashmiri vernaculars. He was addressing the inaugural session of the International Training Workshop on Language Documentation under the Project Capacity Building Training Program for faculty of public sector universities in Azad Jammu and Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan here on Monday. â€œThe UAJK will launch diploma courses for the preservation and promotion of Kashmiri language and culture and will take all

The post UAJK, USEFP launch project to save endangered languages appeared first on the Wallet.
